work.name: 職引國際有限公司
work.summary: Experienced in developing high-complexity, scalable, data-driven front-end projects with a focus on performance, user experience, and system integration. Participated in development of a complex Micro-services Hexagonal DDD Spring Java project.
highlights: Developed a data-intensive Angular project for internal use in the national healthcare system, focusing on managing complex data sets and implementing business logic.
responsibilities: Developed and maintained front-end projects, ensuring scalability, performance, clean code, efficient architecture and robust user experiences.
Collaborated with cross-functional teams of developers, designers, and project managers to deliver high-quality solutions.
Ensured code quality and optimized front-end performance to meet user needs and business objectives.
Managed complex, data-intensive projects, ensuring smooth integration of business logic and user interfaces.
Designed and developed highly reactive components and workflows to improve application efficiency and user interaction.
achievements: Optimized front-end performance by resolving critical issues, improving page load times, and enhancing user experience.
Developed an internal tool to streamline client-owned code documentation, introducing interactive design guidelines and testable components.
Created a highly complex Angular application for the national healthcare system, successfully handling large-scale data and implementing intricate business logic.
Built reusable and scalable Vue components for a multinational client, ensuring consistency and improving code quality across multiple platforms.

work.name: 國立暨南國際大學
work.position: Teaching Assistant – University Social Responsibility (USR) Project
work.summary: Supported the University Social Responsibility (USR) project, focusing on water resource conservation and sustainable regional development. Assisted in coordinating interdisciplinary collaboration between students, faculty, local governments, and industries to implement real-world sustainability initiatives.
highlights: Facilitated student engagement in water resource conservation, sustainable energy practices, and pollution reduction efforts.
Coordinated interdisciplinary and cross-sector collaboration among students, faculty, local communities, and government agencies.
responsibilities: Assisted in organizing workshops, field studies, and community engagement activities related to water resource sustainability.
Guided students in developing innovative action plans that integrate environmental conservation and local industry development.
Facilitated discussions on balancing water conservation with economic development in upstream watershed areas.
Managed project logistics, including stakeholder coordination, data collection, and event planning.
Provided academic and technical support to students in researching and implementing sustainability-focused projects.
achievements: Led a team of students in a cross-disciplinary research project, analyzing the impact of water conservation practices on local industries.
Organized a community outreach program that connected students with local government and industry leaders to promote sustainable water management.
Developed an online knowledge-sharing platform to document and disseminate best practices in environmental sustainability.
Helped secure funding for student-led sustainability initiatives through grant proposals and industry partnerships.

work.name: 國立暨南國際大學
work.position: Teaching Assistant – Business Data Networks and Security
work.summary: Assisted in teaching Business Data Networks and Security, providing support in network infrastructure, cybersecurity principles, and hands-on system administration. Helped students understand key concepts related to network protocols, security mechanisms, and risk management.
highlights: Guided students in configuring secure network infrastructures, including VLANs, firewalls, and VPN setups.
Developed and graded hands-on labs covering topics such as network security, TCP/IP protocols, and intrusion detection systems.
responsibilities: Conducted lab sessions and tutorials, explaining fundamental networking concepts and security measures.
Assisted students with troubleshooting networking issues, including packet analysis and firewall configurations.
Designed and reviewed assignments on networking protocols, encryption techniques, and network defense strategies.
Provided technical support for network security projects, ensuring students implemented best practices in cyber defense.
Collaborated with professors to refine course materials and improve hands-on lab experiences.
achievements: Implemented an interactive cybersecurity simulation for students to practice threat mitigation techniques.
Developed a real-world case study on network security breaches, helping students analyze vulnerabilities and apply mitigation strategies.
Enhanced lab efficiency by introducing automated network configuration scripts, reducing setup time by 40%.
Created a knowledge-sharing platform for students to discuss and troubleshoot security challenges collaboratively.

work.name: 國立暨南國際大學
work.position: Teaching Assistant – Seminar in Information Management
work.summary: Facilitated academic discussions and research presentations in a seminar course focused on emerging topics in Information Management. Provided guidance to students on research methodologies, critical thinking, and effective presentation techniques.
highlights: Mentored students in developing research topics, refining their methodologies, and structuring their presentations.
Organized and moderated weekly discussions on industry trends, case studies, and academic papers.
responsibilities: Assisted students in preparing research presentations and ensuring content clarity, coherence, and academic rigor.
Reviewed and provided feedback on research proposals, ensuring proper methodology and literature support.
Facilitated discussions on current topics in Information Management, encouraging critical analysis and knowledge-sharing.
Coordinated guest lectures and industry talks to expose students to real-world applications of research topics.
Managed seminar logistics, including scheduling, material distribution, and technical support for virtual/hybrid sessions.
achievements: Developed a structured evaluation framework to assess student presentations, improving feedback quality and engagement.
Organized a student-led mini-conference, allowing participants to showcase their research findings in a professional setting.
Introduced an interactive Q&A system using digital tools, enhancing participation and engagement during seminars.
Created a research repository compiling seminar discussions and student papers, serving as a reference for future cohorts.

projects.name: SpaceX Invaders
projects.description: A Space Invaders game with a retro look, made with Vue3 and TypeScript. It's a fun project to showcase my skills in Vue3 and TypeScript.
